projects.title: Ska8er-Site
projects.description: Our first project in class. We were given an image of a website and we had to recreate the site. It was meant to teach us principles of HTML and CSS.
projects.problem: Trying to figure out how to position things in the correct space and order.
projects.lessons: I learned how to use CSS Grid and Flexbox quite well. Also learned how to use pseudo elements.

projects.title: Create-Etsy-Search-Page
projects.description: Given a mock-up of an Etsy page, we had to recreate the page. We were also given a file with dummy data to be used for the search.
projects.problem: How to dynamically import the data without typing all of it out.
projects.lessons: This was our first step into JavaScript. I also learned how to use jQuery to create a template to map through and display the data.

projects.title: Group-Project
projects.description: A group assingment where we utilized Github for version control and collaboration to make a website for a fictional restaurant. We were given a JSON file with menu items.
projects.problem: How do we work on the same project without causing problems and still creating a cohesive looking website.
projects.lessons: I learned how to use Github's branches to ensure my team could work on the same website but in different sections to avoid conflicts.

projects.title: React-Shopping-Cart
projects.description: Our first steps in React. We had to recreate a T-shirt website with the ability to add and delete in a cart as well as simulating a checkout/receipt screen.
projects.problem: How to use React and Redux to control the state of items in the cart.
projects.lessons: I learned how to effectively use components to make my code more manageable as well as creating a seamless experience for the user. I also learned how to use Redux to monitor the state of items in the cart as well as some new CSS properties.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Redux, Node.js

projects.title: Ryan_List
projects.description: We were tasked with making a replica CraigsList website where users could search and add postings using React components and a MySQL database.
projects.problem: Using React and Redux to keep track of several different pieces of state on differenet components while integrating a MySQL database.
projects.lessons: I learned how to construct useful and concise MySQL queries to retrieve date from and add data to the database.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Redux, Node.js, Express, MySQL

projects.title: Jurn(ease)
projects.description: A group travel planning app that encompasses everything I learned at PunchCode.
projects.problem: How do you take an idea from conception to a finished application.
projects.lessons: I learned how to plan and execute a large project, how to take all the languages and tools from class and apply them to one big, how to use AWS as a remote MySQL database for our project, and I learned how to accomplish all of this while working remotely.
projects.tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Redux, Node.js, Express, MySQL, AWS
